title: Elaine Feinstein, Liverpool-born poet, playwright, biographer and gifted translator of Russian literature – obituary
text:
Elaine Feinstein, who has died aged 88, was a novelist, dramatist, biographer and, most of all, a poet whose own work often attracted less attention than her groundbreaking translations of Russian poetry, in particular the work of Marina Tsvetaeva.

When Elaine Feinstein’s work began appearing in the 1960s, it was experimental, uninhibited and honest. In person she was unfailingly polite and charming – even if a book of hers received negative reviews, she would thank editors “for giving it space” – but one of her triumphs as a writer was to overcome a diffidence she saw as peculiarly English.

This was because she saw herself as an outsider. As she put it in an interview with Peter Lawson: “Look,...
